entry.title: Atomia - The Adventures of Arpie
entry.summary: Atomia is a 2D role-playing game made for educational and entertainment purposes.
entry.content:
Atomia is a 2D role-playing game made for educational and entertainment purposes.

 

 

 

Atomia is a spin-off project from Fullerene. This project is supervised by Dr Alexander Ma, and was developed in the Rensselaer Center for Open Source (RCOS).

Link to:

  • Github
  • Fullerene (parent project)

entry.title: Project Voice
entry.summary: The Voice Project was a multi-semester project that aimed to develop and…
entry.content:
The Voice Project was a multi-semester project that aimed to develop and assist alternative communication methods for nonverbal patients. This started as a project pitched by Ed Fennell to the Rensselaer Center for Open Source (RCOS), which I then helped take upon a leader role in helping push this cause forward.

2026 Colloquium for the Improvement of Nonverbal Patient Care Technologies (CINPCT)

This colloquium is aimed at bringing awareness among academia, industry and students about how various existing technologies can come together to create assistive devices for nonverbal people. It is a mostly student-run conference, with the assistance of Dr. Juergen Hahn, Ed Fennell.

To access the website for the conference, click here. To see the talks and panels from the conference, click here.

Independent Research Project

During the RCOS project, I led the sensors team, where we analyzed various types of sensors for biometric sensing. I particularly focused on wearable technologies such as the Apple Watch.

Link to:

  • RCOS Webpage
  • Project Github
  • CINPCT 2026

entry.title: Fullerene
entry.summary: Fullerene is a chemistry modelling simulator + educational mini-games hub, where students…
entry.content:
Fullerene is a chemistry modelling simulator + educational mini-games hub, where students from high school to first-year college students can learn and practice their chemistry knowledge.

 

Project Visuals:

This project is supervised by Dr Alexander Ma, and was developed in the Rensselaer Center for Open Source (RCOS).

Link to:

  • Github
  • RCOS Project Website
  • RPG Spin-Off Project

entry.title: Watermelon Lights
entry.summary: Watermelon Lights is a circuit system that lights an LED based on…
entry.content:
Watermelon Lights is a circuit system that lights an LED based on the frequency of your sound input. Similar to Clap-On Lights, this project is intended to provide a simple and easy way for controlling the lights in your house.

The circuit system has three key aspects: sound input, amplification, and filtering. To achieve this, we used operational amplifiers, 555 timers, an electret microphone and created a frequency filter (initially passive, then switched to active). 

Watermelon Lights was a semester-long project made for Electric Circuits, and was presented at the Mercer X Corridor of Creativity and Community.

Link to:

  • Mercer X Grand Opening Presentation
  • Final Project Manual
  • Milestone 1
  • Milestone 2
  • Milestone 3
